intro: Gilia nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gilia nevadensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
